result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert J Bowe Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Straight Time. Sentence credit of 1 day was 
granted if imposed.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered. Inform agent of all prescriptions.

No Violent contact with the victim. To write a letter of apology to the victim. Defendant to work with attorney on letter. Maintain full time employment and/or school combination. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: As a condition of probation, as directed by agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
Straight Time if imposed.
Consecutive to: Count 1

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

records.addlTxt: Treatment and character letters filed.
Sentencing hearing at 12-09-2015 10:30 am
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Robert J Bowe in court with attorney Matthew Huppertz.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count #1 and a plea of guilty to Count #2.  The Court finds the Defendant guilty on both counts.  Attorney Huppertz requests a seperate sentencing date and the State does not object.   Bail remains.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 9, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Hearing at 10-23-2015 10:00 am

Defendant Robert J Bowe in court with attorney Matthew Huppertz.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is half way through counseling. Defense requests a date in 30 - 45 days. Court grants request. Defense to advise on the next date how they will proceed.  Hearing scheduled for October 23, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 8, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Matthew Huppertz in court.   Defendant Robert J Bowe did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney appears by authorization. Defense has reviewed all of the DVD's. Defense has referred his client to counseling. Defense requests a date in 60 days. Court grants request.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on July 22, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Authorization to appear received and filed.

Attorney Matthew Huppertz in court.   Defendant Robert J Bowe did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Attorney appears by authorization.   Attorney has received discovery and requesting additional time to review the discovery.  Hearing scheduled for July 22, 2015 at 09:30 am.
with cover letter filed by Atty. Huppertz dated 05/28/2015
Hearing on June 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with victim listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

Defendant Robert J Bowe in court, in custody by phone from Waukesha County Jail, with attorney Matthew Huppertz.  Lucas Paul Bennewitz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for June 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
